Reviews.Title: “I've had better ive had worse.”
Reviews.Author: MissyBissy
Reviews.Content: Few things. With what we paid for a "suite" I would expect a mini fridge or a microwave. Our air conditioning was broken. Our tub had no way to stop the water so you could take a bath. The operator sent up maintenance and honestly that sweet man is responsible for most of the stars on the review. I hope they appreciate what an awesome find they have. I can't remember his name but he only has sons and was very sweet to our little girls. The issues were fixed fast and we were able to enjoy our stay. The lady in the gift shop was also a sweetheart I wish the pull out sofa had more blankets and our room ran out of tp. Service was excellent overall. Would have preferred more food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely surprised”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel on business for one night, and would be excellent for precruise stay. Extremely close to Port of Los Angeles. Valet parking $10/ night. Service excellent. Very helpful. Little things make a difference. Shower cap in bathroom. Strong hot water pressure in shower. Tub drains very well. No problems. Clip on drapes if you want to ensure that there is no light in your room. Did have a problem with an elevator, but it was quickly fixed. Full serve restaurant on premises but we did not eat there. Would definitely stay again. Bed kind of hard but I had no problem sleeping. Bathroom and room spotlessly clean and newer looking. Thank you Crowne Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for pre-cruise stays”
Reviews.Author: LBeach99
Reviews.Content: Got a real good deal on Hotwire for a pre-cruise stay here (we usually stay at the Doubletree) and we were pleasantly surprised. The location was perfect for cruising. We walked all over San Pedro and never felt unsafe. The hotel services are great. Everyone from the front desk, bellhops, housekeeping, etc were all pleasant and informative about things to do in the area. We will keep this hotel in mind for our next pre-cruise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place especially for cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: StraitGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before boarding our cruise ship. Won a great rate using Priceline! The room was spacious, clean and so quiet. The bed was very comfortable, and the staff is great! There's also a complimentary shuttle to the cruise terminal. I especially enjoyed the fresh apples provided daily in the lobby. The only negative being that we didn't notice any restaurants nearby, so we ate at the Blu Restaurant in the hotel - good food and service. We will definitely stay here again when sailing out of the San Pedro terminal, especially for such a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, big rooms, quiet environment - very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Oceansara
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. I really like the big rooms and the beds are real comfy. I think maybe it's had other bad reviews because the kind of people that stay here are cruise ship passengers who tend to be extremely whiny people. The room service here was some of the best I've seen. Obviously this is not a hotel to vacation, just one to stay to get you to your destination but I think it's one of the better ones! The staff at the front desk could do with a few more manners and better customer service but the waiting staff were great and sweet.

Reviews.Title: “If have to stay in San Pedro . . .”
Reviews.Author: BetsyCairns
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LAX on a Sunday afternoon in order to board a cruise the following day. It seemed to make sense to get close to the cruise terminal while the LA traffic was light, so booked into the Crowne Plaza. We had a lot of luggage and check in was slick. Our room was e xactly what one expects of a Crowne Plaza and represented good value. One block to the west on South Centre St between W 6th and W 7th is a Wells Fargo ATM from which we extracted local currency. Husband had breakfast in the restaurant and pronounced it good while I used the iron and board in the room closet to smarten up some of our stuff. The Hotel runs a free shuttle minibus to places in the locality and were happy to take us to the cruise terminal at midday.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but certainly ok!!”
Reviews.Author: terrynkathy
Reviews.Content: Why is it lobby hotels look so nice and the rooms are not?!!! It is clean, the rooms look really old even on the club/executive level. If I were to be staying before or after a cruise, it is fine. Very convenient location for that and a couple blocks to the marina is a maritime museum and an Acapulco Mexican Chain restaurant. The actual city of San Pedro is pretty run down especially the main street with fast food, fuel, drugstores etc. If you are there with a car, Long Beach is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: linric
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights pre cruise in January. We booked thru priceline and got a good rate and it was well worth what we paid for it. Rooms were clean and we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The restaurant served a very good breakfast and their evening mearls were reasonable. We would stay at this place again for a precruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but didn't like nickel and diming”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a well kept, nicely located hotel for a pre-cruise overnight stay. Was here on a priceline reservation for three rooms since I was taking children and grandchildren on a Disney cruise to Mexico. When checking in we were informed that in order to get a room with two beds, an additional $10 fee was required beyond the priceline bid. I have NEVER before encountered a surcharge for a room with two beds and I travel on a priceline reservation all the time. To use the computer in the business center required a $5 fee, even to print out a boarding pass. Again, a first. Too bad such nice facilities are marred by fees that almost all hotels provide for free.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza LA Harbor best precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1funtravlr
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Crowne Plaza LA Harbor Hotel Feb. 17, 2012 with a "park n sail" package that includes a buffet breakfast, glass of wine at the bar and free shuttle to the ship and back with a secure parking for our car for the length of our cruise (up to 14 days and then they start fees) and our king non smoking room (sometimes we get upgraded to a suite). Reallly worth it. (Though I miss their cook to order eggs, I understand as prices are going up for everything.) It's so great to be so close to the pier, have pleasant and speedy service, wonderful accomodations (nice ammenities-comfortable bed with ample pillows, an aroma therapy sleep kit, that nice rounded shower rod that keeps your curtain clinging the tub and not you, nice little soaps and lotions to use so you don't have to unpack yours if you don't want.) and so far we always got a room with a view of the harbor lights at night and then a view of our cruise ship the next morning. Another benefit of the location, is that there's a Rite Aid a few blocks up if you need to pick up something you forgot before setting sail (I believe that is Gaffey St). Also, several fast food places if you want to eat there or bring it back to the comfort of your room at night. I also want to mention that the manager Allan Hernando went out of his way to help us with a special request for our friends traveling with us. We were really worried that it wouldn't work out but the manager, true to his word, made sure everything went as planned. I also want to thank Brenda at the front desk who caught the miscode on our reservation and rectified it and that she read the notes on our reservation so everything went smoothly. Kudos to all the staff. Thank you so much for making our stay the best! We'll be back in April!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HowardTucson
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we stayed at the Crowne Plaza before going on a cruise -- and it won't be the last time. Check in was a breeze, the staff were courteous and the room was clean. We had a quiet and restful night. We booked the hotel's "park and sail" package, which included our room, complimentary buffet, shuttle to and from the cruise ship and FREE parking. All in all, another great experience at the San Pedro Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Catisha
Reviews.Content: Chiming in, as others have done, to comment on this hotel as a choice for a overnight stay prior to embarking on a cruise departing from San Pedro. It is a decent choice, particularly if one can secure a good price via the bidding sites. The pros: beds are comfortable, and the soap/shampoo/conditioner/lotion amenity package is good-smelling, and seems to be of superior quality. The hotel is perhaps half a mile to the cruise terminal (in fact, we could see the ship from our room), and starting at 10:30, and running every half hour from then on, there is a complimentary shuttle to the terminal. There are eating options within a few blocks of the hotel, as well as a restaurant on-site. We were able to get online in the lobby for free. The cons: we booked non-smoking rooms, but as there are also smoking rooms in this hotel, the air circulation system makes it so there is a perceptible smell of cigarettes in both our room, and our friends' room. (I was torn whether to give this review a "3" rating, instead of "4" based on this factor). Not exactly like being in the presence of someone actively smoking, but still.... . We noticed, as did our friends, various mechanical sounds at all times, which may be annoying and disruptive to the sleep of light-sleepers. The provided in-room coffee was pretty bad, according to our intrepid friends, but the friendly Sacred Grounds Coffee House, up the road on 6th, set us up with good coffee, and free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here Prior to Disney Cruise”
Reviews.Author: sandee_steph
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan 28, 2012. I had seen this hotel list on a website about hotels close to the port. I took a chance and booked on hotwire and got it about $70 cheaper. It is a nice hotel I am really not sure where the negetive remarks are coming from. They had a free shuttle to the port, which was super handy. The restaurant is nice, a bit pricey for breakfast with kids, but they do have a buffet and the staff was very accomodating with the kids! We had 2 adults and 2 kids and got a room with 2 Double beds, with quite a bit of extra room. The hotel was close to an area with a few restaurants, we went to a pizza place Niko's it was good. We did walk about 8 blocks away to a pharmacy and Starbucks -- the area is not great, but it was fine. I recommend this hotel, it is great for a pre-cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Prior To Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Guess69
Reviews.Content: Not to sure where some of the negatives about this hotel are coming from but I had no problems at all, the hotel was great. Flew in two days early for the 18 Jan departure of the Golden Princess. Used SuperShuttle to and from LAX, took a full day tour of LA with Sunseekers Tours which was fun, they will pick you up at the hotel. Caught the hotel shuttle to the pier, no problem here either. I used Hotwire and was able to get the room for $72.00.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise and Park”
Reviews.Author: Vicki A
Reviews.Content: Crown Plaza has a cruise and park package which we took advantage of when sailing on Golden Princess to Hawaii. This is a busy port so other cruise lines use it as well. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood only about three blocks from the dock. Our room was very nice and comfortable, and included two complimentary drinks with dinner and a full breakfast buffet. The bellmen are very quick to help and it was a very good experience. We would stay again in a heartbeat. Our car was delivered back to us almost immediately when we returned from the cruise. They have a shuttle that takes you to the ships. When we returned we decided on a taxi and the fee was $6.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near the port.”
Reviews.Author: rebelface1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the crown plaza just before we left on our cruise to the panama canal. great hotel. its literally 5 min to the port and they have a nice restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “good pre/post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: xvzhankster
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and stayed again this time after our cruise. The hotel seems to be needing a bit of a face lift now, although it is clean and well maintaned. The price was a little high and I think they should let you know that the "club" is closed on weekends if you are staying on the concierge level. I thought the $10 charge for wifi should have been included in our price. The breakfast buffet (an additional $5 upgrade from the voucher for a continental breakfast we would have had, if the lounge was open!) was plain and ordinary. Good place to leave your car for your cruise, if you drove in, but all in all, we'll look for other places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Interesting Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: JohnKurtz
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we needed some "off the shelf" medication for our daughter. The staff had a set of printed directions just about anything we needed. Parking was under the hotel and was included in the deal. The front desk personnel were helpful in pointing out that I should receive Wi-Fi. The room was comfortable with a nice view. looking over the pool on the southside. The pool was out of order, but the hot tub was running.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced Travel Agent Review - Stay & Cruise Port of LA”
Reviews.Author: Aubs-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a travel agent familiarization trip for Aubree's Travel. I generally book my clients at the Doubletree in this area, (I specialize in Disney Cruises) and was looking forward to staying here to see if I would be willing to recommend this property also. I was pleased with my stay. As an agent you try to look at things from all kinds of perspectives, and I also talk to many other guests as I am out and about looking at the property. I also visit with as many staff members as I can. The good - As far as a park & cruise hotel, this property has a perfect location. It is extremely close to the pier. Depending on your room location, you can watch the ships sail in and out (neat!) Our room was perfectly clean. The beds were comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly, as was the bell staff, and the valet staff. The complimentary glasses of wine were a nice touch. We arrived early, and our room was ready. Everything went very smooth. The mediocre- We found it slightly inconvenient that to get to our car we had to have the valet bring it every time. We were a bit spazzy in that we needed to put more things in the car/overnight bag, and get other things out as we prepared to sail out the next day. This meant we had to have them get the car (and tipped them) 3 times. It would have been great if the lot had been easily accessible to us just so we could get in and out of our trunk without involving valet, but overall, not a big deal, just a statement really, and had we thought things through better, this wouldn't have been an issue. The less than great - the pool water was absolutely freezing (mind you, it was November). I noticed a middle age couple in the lobby that looked a bit frazzled and I started up a conversation with them. They were frustrated with the front desk staff because they were wanting a shuttle ride to somewhere nearby, and were told no. They countered that the website said they provided shuttle rides within a few mile radius, but the customers said the front desk staff had told them that was wrong, and that they should have been looking at the local website rather than the national one. At that point they were showing me on their phone what the Crowne Plaza website said, and the gentlemen from the concierge was agreeing that they were right, and as I left, I felt secure he was going to take care of the guest. The buffet the next morning was our least favorite thing about the stay. Although we had 4 guests, we received 2 vouchers for the buffet. We arrived about 5 minutes after they opened. There were only a handful of things out on the buffet, most of the hot items were cold (odd, I know), almost like they were warming them up from the day before?? By the time we paid our bill, they were still putting things out for the buffet, so we didn't get to have the majority of the things that were offered due to how late they were at getting them out. Our gentleman waiter was really, really out of it. He commented about being out too late the night before, and I am very nearly certain he was quite hung over. He only came by our tale 2 additional times, and spent most of his time giggling with a female employee off to the side. All in all, our breakfast was a bust, but that was my biggest complaint about the property, and it really has nothing to do with the room. I thought the price was moderate to high, but comparable to the other prices in the area for a stay and cruise rate. I would recommend this property to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great Package Price for Park 'n' Sail”
Reviews.Author: Grokker
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is a perfectly adequate hotel. Of course perfectly adequate doesn't encourage a rush of customers. We used the hotel for Park and Sail and it was great for that. The price was right and it included parking, a welcome glass of wine, a buffet breakfast, and transportation to the pier. The greeting by the bell staff was cordial and welcoming. The desk staff made one feel as if one were intruding upon something far more important that the desk clerk had to do than check one in. One did not like the feeling. We stayed on the executive level. They had hors d' oeuvres at night and continental breakfast in the morning. Both were shoddy. The lounge ladies were interesting. One was complaining and the other was loud and obnoxious. The evening snacks were sad and the morning breakfast breads were sad. dry, and pathetic. One had to ask for butter. One finally gave up and went down to the included breakfast buffet. It was tragically sad. Rather than serving the food the staff should have put it out of its misery and called in for food from another restaurant. And perhaps if the staff looked as if they wished to be there and be working it would have helped. The bar was alright. The decor was wilted. The room was nice but nothing special. The mattress was soft and comfy. The person who took us to the ship was wonderful. She was warm and cheerful and what everyone there should have been. It's too bad they weren't but kudos to the shuttle lady and the valet staff. The rest of them should go through retraining.

Reviews.Title: “Close to cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: 2_cruzen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza the night before the cruise. Was tired after a long airplane ride and was pleasantly greeting upon entering the room with a gift bag on the bed. It included a sleeping mask, earplugs, and most appreciative - a spray bottle of lavendar linen spray. This hotel is within walking distance of a couple of nice restaurants BUT walk up 7th street not 6th. Felt perfectly safe with my husband. Even found a little store to buy some pop to bring aboard the ship. In the morning, we went up 6th street to the Subway for a quick, cheap breakfast, but there is a very nice pastry shop on 7th street. If we would have had time, there is a museum just a block from the hotel and a Merchant marine exhibit. Was able to walk down to see the ship at the pier. Hotel provides a free shuttle to the cruise port. Get on the 10:30 shuttle and check-in will be a BREEZE! Will definitely stay there again if we ever cruise from San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Park 'n Ride”
Reviews.Author: felinesStockton_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in February before setting sail on a 7 day Mexican cruise. They offer park and ride which we always look for when going on a cruise. The hotel was very nice and the room very clean. They have a lovely restaurant and great bar which we took advantage of. Hotel staff were attentive and friendly and if sailing from San Pedro we'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great...clean...”
Reviews.Author: tly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one night stay..it was very clean....riom was nice...only downfall was no nearby fastfood and the parking garage was a little scary...it was free which was nice but if i had not been with an adult man i would have felt a little untimidated in the parking lot. It was a nice stay though and is great for someone needing to stay before cruising

Reviews.Title: “Nice calm stay in LA area”
Reviews.Author: jsolt
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza LA Harbour is located in downtown San Pedro a bit of the main freeway routes which is unlike to plenty of hotels in the LAX area (LA airport). We got an upgrade to a faboulous corner suite overlooking LA Harbour which was an excellent experience. World Maritim complex is nearby, also the Maritim museum and some restaurants. However a car helps to be quick at plenty of beautiful beach cities or attractions as Long Beach or Anaheim. Nice pool, friendly staff, free parking and large rooms, also the standard ones, are perks as well. Very recommended

Reviews.Title: “good launch pre-cruise out of san pedro”
Reviews.Author: beckyjake123
Reviews.Content: Before sailing out of San Pedro on a nine day cruise, this hotel offers a park n sail package upon request. We arrived the night before the sail date. For under $300, it covered nine nights valet parking, four drinks, four adult buffet breakfasts and free shuttle to and from the port. Parking at the port is $12/day times 9 days = $108. The drinks might have been about $7.00 each for $28.The buffet might have been about $20 per person for another $80, so that leaves about $70 for one night's stay. It's an ok deal, price wise, but a very relaxing way to start a cruise. they were quick to get us to the port; and getting off the boat and finding the shuttle back to the hotel was easy too. So overall, this is a nice way to set sail. The hotel is clean, linens nice, the service was fine, the breakfast buffet had all the standard fare. one down side, I think they only had two double beds, not queens and wi fi is not free. : (

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and walking distance to pier”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before cruising on Carnival Cruise. It's very close to the pier and has great views! We were so excited to wake up and see our ship waiting for us in the harbor! The hotel provides a free shuttle to the pier. (And they picked us up when we got back from the cruise too.) We did the "park and sail" pass at the hotel, which allowed us to leave our car parked in their covered garage while we were on our cruise for $10/day. The only disappointment was the jets in the hot tub didn't work. Other than that, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but it needs a major upgrade on everything”
Reviews.Author: tamago r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the weekend. People were nice and kind but an entire hotel needs a major upgrade on everything. Rooms- Very 90s and everything seems to be worn out. Even though we stayed at one of the suites but it was one of the oldest room I've seen. Gym- No Treadmills. All machines are at least 10-20 years old. No working TV.... No priority club treat- Priority club members usually receive welcome fruits or confectionery upon arrival but we had nothing...this is such a minor thing but it can be really disappointing while knowing others give you a bottle of milk and cookies. Again, there are a few things are cons! people are nice and helpful. It has a (free) parking garage attached. There were pools and restaurants but we did not go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to stay in this hotel. I have a classmates gathering in LA area so I booked three rooms for 2 nights in this hotel from 9/30 - 10/2. I am platinum Ambassador member. I got one room upgrade to suite and another room upgrade to mini suite in the members floor. Both rooms are both connected and it looks like a big apartment. All of the rooms are very clean. The beds are comfortable. The sofa is good. There are not many choice for lounge club breakfast but the food quality is good. The staffs are very friendly and nice. Overall it is a surprice nice hotel in that area. My only complain is the show head. The water is a little bit slow and "no pressure". I recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, first class staff”
Reviews.Author: Graceology
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, excellent restaurant. This hotel is always good, clean, and extremely friendly. The restaurant is actually delicious and their management staff goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Esty666
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to LA because we were doing to Long Beach marathon, and I had found this hotel online, close by and not too expensive. Our room was was fine, clean, but there were few of the gadgets you’d find elsewhere inside your room. Normally when we travel we use Super 8, and always get a large fridge, for instance, and a coffee machine … not here … and you pay for the use of the Internet, and then it was somewhat dodgy and kept dropping out, which was a pain since I lug my laptop along only because I actually have to do some work on it, not just for fun. We were there in October – and it was cool out (we come from Arizona) – but the lobby was cooled down to freezing (well, almost). Fortunately the AC could be turned off in the room. The view from the room was sensational, right across the harbor, cruise and container terminals – we had the good luck to see one of those massive floating-town cruise ships berthed and got to watch it sail. The location of the hotel is great, just a block or two from the shore and close to the cruise terminals, if that I your destination. And it was a less than ten minute’s walk to the local version of the fisherman’s wharf where you can find a whole row of restaurants/shops offering fresh seafood – actually, some of it can be bought alive (lobster). There’s also a ‘village’ with touristy shops. The restaurant in the hotel was good, too. Staff was exceedingly friendly and accommodating and helpful, also in view of our pre-marathon special requirements. We were also told that we could register at a counter in the lobby for free transportation to the start of the marathon, and you could choose different times to get there – and back, which sounded like great service. That proved a bit tricky. First, there was nobody there, then the next guy didn’t have the registration lists and told us to come back later. We did that and that guy in turn took a note – lists still absent, and that was the late after noon before the marathon. I think it was the fourth time or so of my going back before I was actually reasonably sure we were registered for transport. On the morning of the marathon – yes, it was VERY early – special small breakfast had been set out for the marathon runners. That was nice and much appreciated. And the vans to take us there were there as promised, and left almost on time. What was a real shambles was that our driver had absolutely no clue – as we found out – where he was taking us apart from the general vicinity. He was just told to follow the van ahead of him – which he promptly lost of course at a red light. After some useless driving around and getting stuck in a line while heading up the ramp of a multilevel parking lot (I thought that wasn’t the smartest) move, one of the other runners in the van finally told him to just stop, since she recognized from an earlier year that we were very close, and we just walked the rest of the way. That was not what you need before a marathon, knowing there will be endless crowds and you really want to get to the starting line in time. We were also booked for the return trip, but since we now couldn’t be sure where exactly the pick-up point was – same as the proper drop-out, but we’d never seen that – we opted to take a taxi back. In conclusion, as a hotel, I can recommend the place. Prices were higher than we were used to, but it’s LA after all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable beds, good restaurants near by.”
Reviews.Author: Dave_the_Oracle_DBA
Reviews.Content: Solo business traveler. I have two clients in the area, so I've spent about 3 weeks at this hotel in the past few months. The beds and pillows are quite comfortable. The rooms are clean and they have wifi (for a $10/day fee). The restaurant downstairs is only fair and over priced but there are several better options near by (San Pedro Brewing Co. and Niko's Pizza are both very good. Niko's will even deliver to the room & is by far a much better value than room service). The neighborhood around the hotel can be a bit shady, but they seem to be making efforts to improve this (increased police presence and several guys in yellow "redevelopment" t-shirts walking around answering tourist questions.). A few things in the rooms could use updating. There aren't very many channels on the TV, and it isn't a flat panel. No movies on demand or anything like that. Free self parking is a plus (most of the comparable hotels in downtown Long Beach charge $20/nt) Long Beach is just a few minutes away over the bridge. All in all, I'd say it is one of the better values in the area (This one and the Double Tree are the ones I like best down here).

Reviews.Title: “Not a Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ccws19
Reviews.Content: The area around the hotel has fallen to deperation and is not very safe. My wife was accosted just outside the resteraunt entrance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for cruises”
Reviews.Author: BarryJ_100
Reviews.Content: A good quality hotel, with easy shuttle [free] access to the San Pedro cruise terminal. a nice restaurant and well maintained rooms. Not much around the hotel, but if you are using it as a cruise starter or to finish then the location is perfect. Friendly staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose very well!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBearsFan650
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel the night before we departed on the Disney Wonder Mexican Rivera cruise. We drove down from the Bay Area the night before, and just needed a convenient place to stay for one night. Check In and Front Desk: Check in was handled promptly and extremely courteously. Its possible that I've never met a friendlier front desk clerk. We had booked a room with 1 king bed, not thinking that we'd need two, since it was us and our kids. When we realized this in our first room, I called down to the desk, and within 10 minutes, a hotel employee arrived with a key to our new room, with two double beds. There was a nominal price increase for the room, which didn't bother me a bit. Lobby: The lobby was a little dated looking, other than that, fairly unremarkable. Room: The room was clean. It was a fairly small room, however. If you are taking a cruise, many rooms will have views of the ships. Be sure to ask and they might be able to get a good room for you. It was really fun for the kids (and me) to watch the Disney Wonder docking a few hours before we boarded. Other rooms will have a view of the ship as it approaches. Restaurant: After reading several negative reviews of the restaurant, we swore we wouldn't eat there. However, by the time we got to San Pedro, we were tired and hungry, and couldn't find a place to park near some of the higher rated restaurants. We didn't feel like hunting around anymore, and it was also fairly cold and windy out, so we ruled out parking at the hotel and walking. So, we made the decision to eat in the hotel. The restaurant was fine. I might have been disappointed if I had actually gone out of my way to seek that restaurant out, but considering we could just ride down in the elevator, eat and ride back up to our room, it served its purpose just fine. The food was a little overpriced, and fairly plain, but the service really shined. Our server was really friendly, and when my daughter complained about having parmesan cheese on her spaghetti (before we had a chance to tell her to just deal with it) he insisted on taking it back and bringing a fresh one. Honestly, the great service made up for the average food. We also had breakfast on the morning we left. It was a fairly expensive breakfast buffet, but the food was all good. The omelette server was really friendly. It inspired another guest to remark "best omelette I've had all week!" I certainly was in agreement. Location: The location is the primary reason we chose the hotel. It was about 5 minutes or less to the World Cruise Center, where the Disney Cruise departed from. The hotel does run a shuttle to the cruise center, but we had our car, and had planned on parking at the Cruise Center itself. The hotel is located on one of the main streets in San Pedro near some shops and restaurants. It was really quiet, but there were some slightly odd people walking around the neighborhood, which was another reason we decided to just stay in for dinner. Parking: The hotel offers complimentary self parking, which we used. The underground lot is really old and involves some touchy navigation if you drive a mega SUV like me. Actually, there were barely any spaces left when we arrived. They do offer valet parking as well. I had considered a "stay and park" package, but calculated it would cost around $30 less to just park at the World Cruise Center. I didn't anticipate eating breakfast at the hotel, and I think the package included breakfast. So, when we got breakfast, I think we ended up even with the stay and park package. On the other hand, if you do that, you'd need a shuttle back to the hotel, which would just increase the time and number of steps before you are back on the road. Its something to consider, however. Overall, I we had a perfectly good stay at the Crowne Plaza Los Angeles Harbor. The service really stood out, and for me showed how that can make up for other areas where a hotel might be lacking slightly. If we were cruising out of the World Cruise Center, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, though I would also consider other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: VancouverWorldsites
Reviews.Content: If you're taking a cruise out of San Pedro/Long Beach, this is the hotel to stay. It was absolutely fantastic. Great location. It's only about a 5 minute shuttle to the cruise terminal with free shuttles running every 30 minutes. The rooms were very clean and modern looking. Very up to date and comfortable. The staff was very prompt and courteous. Could ask for better accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: DSM305
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before leaving on a cruise out of the San Pedro port. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Service was friendly, even providing us a late-morning check-in. The room was quiet and comfortable, but it was beginning to show a few small signs of wear and tear. The pool area was well-kept with plenty of fresh towels and lounge chairs available. Room service breakfast was subpar even for a three-star hotel, so skip that in favor of Think Cafe just up the street and around the corner. There are many local shops and restaurants in the neighborhood around the hotel if you're willing to walk a few blocks and explore. The free shuttle service to the cruise terminal is also a nice perk. All in all, a solid choice for a stay of just a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful With Belongings”
Reviews.Author: LucyLynn
Reviews.Content: I had a purse stolen in the restaurant, one hour before ship departure. I had it with me in the buffet line, but when I went back to get orange juice, it was on the floor beside my chair which was beside a wall. When we looked at the security film, a man took the empty seat behind mine, kicking the purse his way as he moved his chair out. He then left, using his body as a shield so my husband didn't see. He exited through the empty bar (it was Sunday) which has an outside entrance. He was on the street in less than a minute. Crowne Plaza does not have safes in the rooms and the line for the front desk is always so long that using their safe for a few minutes while you eat is not feasible.

Reviews.Title: “WATER NOT SO HOT”
Reviews.Author: Love2Cruise80033
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us staying in 3 different rooms for 1 night as we were going on a cruise in the morning. The beds were very comfortable, walking distance to nice inexpensive restaurants, very friendly front desk. The only problem the 6 of us had was NO HOT WATER in the morning. I did finish taking my shower using cool water hoping that it would get warmer but never did. I called the front desk and complained. I was told that maintenance would be contacted and would be fixed in 10 minutes, it never did happen. The other 5 did brave it and showered. When everyone was ready to leave for the cruise the free hotel shuttle took us to our ship. The next time we sail from Los Angeles we will stay at the DoubleTree Hotel in San Pedro the day before the cruise

Reviews.Title: “Not upto Crown Plaza status”
Reviews.Author: DBB22
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was acceptable and resturant provided a nice start to the day. We were here on a "Park and Cruise" package. Several issues with service: Number one - NO HOT WATER. This seems to be a common theme among reviews and pay attention becuase it happened to us. When we inquired they suggested we use the swimming pool showers. And first I thought they were kidding but this seemes to be commonplace and so many were complaining that no compensation was offered. Number two - Shuttle service was overwhelmed. Consider this if youwant to be on the ship early. We waiting for over two hour in line for their "courtesy shuttle" before we opted for a cab. Its a short ride but still stressfull - not they way you want to start. Number three - Valet service was overwhelmed. Dozens of cars to park and deliver often at the same time as cruise passengers getting off the ship met those trying to park. With only two vallet attendants ou can imagine the mess. Next time we will self park which is directly adjacent to cruise terminals and save a headache.

Reviews.Title: “Very slow and refused use of coupons at the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: kris9510
Reviews.Content: The regestration process took forever. We had purchased coupons at the Blu on restaurant.com the day before the trip and they refused to accept them. We stayed for breakfast and the service was so slow and the food only warm. We asked to speak woth the manager of the Blu and he was rude. We were the only people in the restaurant, one would think that they would accept for some business. Very expensive for such poor quaity, would rather have eaten at McD's. The hotel was nice but there was NO WATER in the morning. NO SHOWERS, TEETH BRUSHING OR FLUSHING. They had no idea of when it would be on again.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed...!”
Reviews.Author: VegasKid49
Reviews.Content: On December 4, 2010 my wife and I stayed at the Crown Plaza in San Pedro (Los Angeles) California prior to boarding on the Mariner of The Seas. I had read several reviews on Trip Advisor and I was very comfortable with their advices…. Well, when we got there the “check in” was extremely slow and the service in their bar was even worst…It seemed like the attendants were more attentive to the paperwork that had to be done rather than to the guest waiting to get served….. But the “bouquet” was in the morning when we attempted to take a shower….We had NO HOT WATER….Nothing not even luke warm. We went to breakfast and tried again ….this time we had luke warm water that turned to cold fairly quickly….not good for a hotel of this caliber! Upon checkout I advised the clerk of the situation and she said….”Oh well”. I am a frequent traveler with “Holiday Inn” and believe me that the next time I will be more careful in selecting a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay - basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce-Two
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre-cruise. It's fine for that but nothing special. WIth its star rating, I had expected a nicer hotel. Great area. Plenty of nice places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice LA San Pedro Harbor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qwovadis
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel up bidding priceline.com $55 good value.As a priority club member got a suite upgrade.Location pretty good in downtown San Pedro a couple of blocks from the cruise port with good restaurants nearby.Sadly no little service compnent to speak of no free wifi no free breakfast room wa renovated pretty nice bed decent views out to sea from my room.Overall would stay here again for similar value play in that area bidding priceline.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE TO STAY PRE CRUISE...”
Reviews.Author: HOMMEBRONZE
Reviews.Content: We drove from San Diego to San Pedro and spent a great one night pre cruise stay at the perfectly located Crowne Plaza. Check in was a breeze. The room was very well appointed and has a little bag of Lavender Linen Spray and cd to help you sleep. We loved using the spray on our pillow before we went to bed. I think I dreamed better. The cd gives you stretches to help you relax as you go to bed but honestly we played it several times in the rooms cd player and it helped us get ready for our cruise. We ate at nearby Ports of Call restaurant..great views of harbor and great hamburgers. At night, we ate at Green Onion Mexican restaurant had terrific margaritas and a platter of Mexican goodies. We slept well. The next morning we ate breakfast at the hotel dining room and then went for a walk to see our ship that was docked that morning. That set us up for the cruise and got us excited. Later, we checked out and took our luggage to front of the hotel. The hotel has 2 shuttles. One they fill with luggage and the other with people. This made our ride to the cruise ship quick and efficient. We left at 11:30 and arrived at cruise terminal in 10 minutes. The 7 day cruise was great and when we returned the Crowne Plaza shuttle was there for the pickup to take us to our car at the hotel. All in all, a very nice way to spend a pre cruise stay in San Pedro. Ca. In fact, we are going back in January to spend our anniversary there with our children, grandchild and explore more of the area.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU PREFER MOTEL 6... & LACK OF SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Dreday_23
Reviews.Content: I was going a Royal Caribean Cruise... this was the best rated in the area - WHAT A JOKE!!! I set up a pick-up from the airport through the hotel. After 1.5 hours of waiting the person showed up with to small of a vechile and had the yelled at me. I was clear with the amount of luggage & people. I ended up taking a shuttle. I'm not sure if this is just the LA way or what! Front desk rude... I guess once they have your $$$ customer service is not longer required! Resturant staff very unprofessional!! I will never stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A surprise mini vacation area”
Reviews.Author: howieeg
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in the L.A. area, so I quickly took advantage of a special deal at the Crowne Plaza Los Angeles Harbor. I was really surprised at its nice location, an up-and-coming city between Los Angeles and Long Beach, and it was barely a half hour away from LAX airport on a Sunday late afternoon drive. The hotel itself had an elegance about it, and the staff couldn't be more friendly and accomodating. Our room was a corner suite with a seperate living room area and a fold-out couch for a second guest (and two nice-size old-style TVs), plus a wet bar and ample windows, which could be open, to take in the L.A. harbor and fresh sea air.. The second-story pool was well landscape for a resort feel, but apparently there is also free shuttle service to nearby beaches. The food is, well, hotel food, but I actually enjoyed the continental breakfasts better in the executive lounge, where the hostesses provided ample juices, coffees, pastries, cerials, fruit and information about the area. By all means take a five-minute (at most) walk to a festival area filled will open-air Mexican-style restaurants, brimming with fresh seafood and the sound of mariachi bands. Or you can stroll accross the street to a charming Hungarian pastry shop for lunch or a snack. Other restaurants a block away as well. There's also a maritime museum and an actual trolley line for shopping and dining a little farther out. And for those tourists (aparently few) who aren't at the hotel as a stay-over before a cruise, you can still take a $13 boat tour of the harbor area, or a bit pricer trip to Catalina Island for a day. There is a small charge for Internet, but no hidden resort fee, and, a true L.A. raritiy, covered, secure parking is free as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel food EVER!”
Reviews.Author: patriot2010
Reviews.Content: All I really have to say about this hotel is save your money and time and go eat somewhere other than the hotel. Ate there several nights and it was TERRIBLE. The food was not cheap either. The wings were dry and tasteless, the egg rolls had grease dripping down my hand, the so called "Cuban" sandwich would have gotten someone beat up if they tried to serve it in South Florida....it was NO "Cuban" sandwich...it was rolled up in a tortilla and the beef was SO greasy and didnt taste very good, a pasta dish I requested of chicken/penne pasta and red cream sauce had NO flavor and was so boring I forced myself to eat it. The only thing edible that I had while staying there was a simple caesar chicken salad (i mean how could you screw up a salad?). The morning "buffet" was laughable.....the ham slices were swimming in water (gross!), scrambled eggs were not good, the potatoes with onions/green peppers had no flavor...... The chef at this hotel needs to be FIRED! It was absolutely terrible and everyone with us agreed.

Reviews.Title: “One room away from loudest elevator in the world”
Reviews.Author: djss2010
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the room was beautiful, the pool nice, the buffet breakfast good - however we were in room 722 (one away from the elevator) - it was going all night long and sounded like a train running through our room - we would have called to complain and get a new room, but our 2 year old was fast asleep and we did not want to wake her to move. My husband and I were up listening to the noise until after 3am. I complained and the front staff asked if no one had warned us when we checked in. I wrote an email and they said "they investigated" and did not detect the noise - they checked on a Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon - we suffered for an entire saturday night. Would NEVER recommend this for anyone that wants a great night sleep. Too bad - great hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel when you are taking a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Ili_from_Miami
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for us. After reading some of the reviews, I was very hesitant about staying here. Then I started reading some other reviews that eased my mind. I corresponded with a couple of them and was releived to hear different experiences and information. The hotel is around 45 minutes from LAX without traffic. I was told that I would be able to land at other airports that may be closer to the port. I have to share that on all the occassions we dealt with the front desk, at check in, check-out on both of our stays, I experienced EXCELLENT Customer Service. We arrived 3/26/2010. We arrived at 10 PM (arrange the transfer ahead of time!) and upon arrival we were told there was no hot water but that they could relocate us to the Double Tree or get free breakfast. We were so tired after a 6 hour flight we took free breakfast. It was great and they took us to the cruise ship for free, just a nice tip should be given since they are carrying your luggage up and down. The hotel was very pleasant and clean. The breakfast was good and we took the advice of eating at the Green Onion, OMG, GREAT, GREAT, GREAT food. If you speak to the transfer to the ship they can arrange a tour for you to see LA. We truly enjoyed our time there and seeing what we see on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough!”
Reviews.Author: EMTBStation53
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights pre-cruise. The hotel is a very busy place given its proximity to the cruise terminal. We would have preferred to have been able to reserve a place on the shuttle bus rather than to wait in line. Nevertheless, we were pleasantly surprised that they handled the transfers to the pier very well despite the number of ships departing that day.. We booked on line and felt that the hotel room was not worth the $180 we paid. The furnishings were marginal, and the room did not seem as clean as it should have been. Wi-fi was an additional $10 per night. The HVAC was difficult to adjust. There is no safe in the room, which is problematic for cruise ship passengers who have documents, passports and jewelry to protect. We did not eat any meals in the hotel. The breakfast menu was overpriced, and Starbucks and Subway were close to the hotel. One evening, we ate at Casa Tequila, an authentic Mexican restaurant at 712 South Pacific Avenue. We had a wonderful meal with ample leftovers for the next day. We probably would not stay at the Crowne Plaza again because we felt it was overpriced, and the lack of an in-room safe was a major negative.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but get's the job done for a pre-cruise one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Karkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Friday night before our cruise. The food was pretty bad (breakfast buffet and room service), however the rooms were quiet and comfy. The local hotel shuttle (free) took us to Target the morning of the cruise to pick up some extras we forgot at home (remember to tip your driver!). There is also the free shuttle to the port the morning of the cruise. Best rate is the "name your own price" of Priceline. About $60-$95 per night that way. Otherwise rack rate is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel--very clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Greta9
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before leaving on a cruise and could not have asked for a nicer room. We didn't know what to expect because we had read several poor reviews. Shuttle service to the ship was very efficient. We ate at the Green Onion Mexican Restaurant about 1/2 block away and it was very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisetmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise. Used Super Shuttle to get to the hotel. Hotel provided the shuttle the next day. Found the staff to be friendly and willing to help. While there were two different events posted in the hotel, we found it to be quiet and a great place to get in the cruise mood. There are several restuarants in the area. We had lunch and breakfast at Grainger - nice family oriented style restuarant. For dinner I highly recommend the Green Onion. We tried Acapulco but when we got there they couldn't find our reservations that were made several weeks earlier. After setting for an hour, we left and walked over to the Green Onion. We were seated within 5 minutes. The food was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here was a real pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Cattlewoman
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure staying in this hotel. Everything was topnotch from the time we entered the lobby. The staff was very accommodating, room was lovely and clean and the restaurant served good food. We stayed here three nights before catching a cruise ship. We found plenty of things to do, like beautiful walks, The ArtWalk, The Red Car, Maritime Museum, Carillo Beach and Aquarium, Farmers Market and the quaint downtown area. The location of this hotel is "wonderful" if you are catching a cruise ship. The locals are so friendly, even had an offer for a ride to an LA attraction, but we found plenty to do right in the San Pedro area. Don't miss staying at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad there is not a better hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: cglex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on the recomendation of a client. This hotel is really a 2.5 star hotel and should not be considered a poor hotel. Full service HIltons, etc. are 3 star, Hampton Inn's 2 star, The Crowne Plaza is positioned as a full service high rise version of a Hampton Inn. The restaurant, room service, etc. gets this hotel the extra half point over a Hampton Inn, Marriott Courtyard, etc. Normallly, I would flunk this hotel, because the hotel internet did not work, and unlike, a Hilton or Marriott chain hotel, there is no central IT support. Call during the day when the IT manager might be around. There is intermittnet wi-fi available from the Port of Los Angeles. However, through out the hotel, the staff is very friendly and that makes up for the lousy internet. Room was a tad larger than a Hampton Inn with Hilton Garden Inn level furniture and the room was clean and not worn. The bathroom was fine but the sink drain did not work and the tub was clogged up. Normal problems. The 10th floor breakfast had very good coffee and a very friendly hostess, but otherwise no hot foods and very low end pastries, blah fruit, etc. - far worse than a Hampton Inn or simllar hotel. I ate at the hotel restuarant once and had a burger. The staff was very friendly, and the burger was rather good. The menu otherwise looked very overpriced. For better options stray a block or less for the Green Onion, a Mexican joint, or Papadakis. This was a one shot trip and my client was in Rolling Hills. Next time I will try something on Redondo beach. I suspect there are better hotels in Long Beach as well, but for me, that was too far from my client. If you have to stay in San Pedro, you might as well stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful way to start a cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler049
Reviews.Content: We arrived from LAX 4 days before our cruise on the Coral Princess. We were wanting to com to the warmer climate a little early. The Steward at the bell desk greeted us as our shuttle arrived. She assisted with our luggage as we waited to check in. We are Priority Club members and usually get the expedited check in - but as there was only 1 person on the desk - and several in front of us - priority doesn't really mean much. The front desk person as well as the bartender could both take lessons in customer service - and how to look as tho' they are happy to see the guests. The 10 floor Priority Club conceirge, Jennifer, was very knowledable of things to do and places to go. She directed us to the 'Red Car' that travels between the bridge and a little beyond the 'ports of call village'. We attended Christmas caroling at a park by the bridge and strolled up and down 6th an d7th Streets. There was a Farmer's Market type of event going on - so it was great fun to wander thru there before settling at Porky's BBQ. This isn't a fancy place - but the food is great and there is a monstrous amount of it. We stayed between the Green Onion and Porky's for our meals for the entire 4 days we were there. The room was very nicely appointed and it has the deepest bathtub I have ever seen. I could actually soak up to my ears in it comfortably. A real nice perk. The previously mentioned mask, scent, and earplugs were also supplied. I was disappointed that our non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor smelled terribly of cigarette smoke which seemed to get stronger the longer we stayed. Since neither of us are allergic and it was otherwise a really nice room with a great view of the Port - we opted to stay in it. The fitness room had quite a selection of equipment for use but neither of the bikes had functioning electronics and the treadmill was a bit tempermental. I was able to do my workout and learned the 1st day to turn the sauna on upon entering so that it would be warm when I finished my workout. The pool an jacuzzi were nice except the temperature on the jacuzzi was rather low. I've run bathwater warmer than it is. BUT, all said, I would recommend this hotel as a definate for the park n ride issues as well as a really nice place to stay. I connected with many other cruisers and got insight on many little tidbits and a LOT of really useful information for our uipcoming cruise from others that had already been on this and were headed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK - Restaurant LOUSY!”
Reviews.Author: mikeanddez
Reviews.Content: Went in for breakfast, dirty coffee cup, they brought another one, but it had a crack down the side and coffee leaking all over, had to get a third one and not sure that one was clean, looked like lipstick on the rim - they should have been apologetic, NOTHING! Grabbed a plate for a muffin, DIRTY. Table DIRTY, not brushed off had crumbs everywhere, kind of sticky, and it was a table cloth one. Would not stay there again, especially at that pricing, would stay and the first one we stayed at in town, and it even included breakfast, with clean dishes.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevesdaughter87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending a convention. They had a nice restaurant and bar which we ate at every night. We had a big room with a very nice bathroom (granite countertops). It was nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: vtxriders
Reviews.Content: Redeemed Priority Club Points for one night stay pre-cruise in a King Executive room. Location is convenient to cruise terminal. Rooms spacious and clean but ours did not have a fridge. We did have a corner room with 2 walls of windows. Ordered room service for a late dinner due to being too tired to go out. The hot wings and meatball sliders were fantastic. The breakfast buffet was nothing to write home about - very limited w/ the exception of the egg/omelet station that required a lengthy wait.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Cruise is worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Histrionix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night (March 15, 200) before a cruise out of San Pedro on Mariner of the Seas. We drove in from Las Vegas and booked the hotel because of the Park and Cruise deal and really felt it was worth it. We found the staff in all areas to be extremely helpful and responsive to any requests we had, especially Carlos who drove the shuttle to and from the ship. The front desk staff was professional and responded quickly and appropriately; it really was a pleasant stay. The negatives aren't enough to detract from the whole. We did find the room to be a little on the shabby side; we were on the sixth floor, looking out over the harbor. The windows were filthy -- I mean, really filthy. I understand it's hard to keep windows clean, but this was kind of beyond that. The room itself was comfortable, with a large seating area, comfy bed, but there were spots on the carpet in places and things (e.g. furniture) were starting to show age. Which is fine. What's not fine was the large spider web going from the lamp to the ceiling -- I told the front desk about it and they were mortified, so appropriate action was taken. I was also glad their "wake up kit" came with ear plugs 'cause it was the loudest room a/c I've ever heard. We did have the buffet breakfast, which was nothing special and not great food, but ok for a quick bite to get you going. The pool area is really in need of a rehab - very bland and boring and nothing at all special. But clean, so it's ok. There's no shade at all, though. And while they advertise a business center and have signs pointing to it, we could never find it --- and we looked and asked. Very strange. What really got us was the parking . . . it's underground, underneath the hotel and we felt very comfortable and safe leaving the car there for a week. When we docked the following Sunday, we didn't even wait 15 minutes off the ship before Carlos was there wiht the van and we were on the road within 20 minutes of debarkation. Couldn't have been happier, so if you're sailing out of San Pedro we would highly recommend using this service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel for RCCL cruise port”
Reviews.Author: chintz1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for 3 nights before our cruise. The RCCL cruise terminal is only about 2 blocks away to it was perfect for that reason. We used Priceline and got a great rate on our room. The rooms are nicely decorated and large. It was nice and clean and had pillow top beds. I was disapointed that there were no refridgerators. We had a third floor room that looked out to the bridge that connects San Pedro to Long Beach. I am not sure why one would want to stay here if they weren't cruising. There is not much in San Pedro and there are no restrants close by. (That's not totally true, there is a waterfront section with some places to eat. We picked a cheap one but it still cost us $30 for 3 of us to eat. The hotel has a restrant also) It is quiet which was nice after fighting the LA traffic while sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: lr0che
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. It is always nice, the rooms comfortable and the service great. The evening supervisor Mr. Simpson goes above board to make sure your stay is a pleasant one. We park and walk everywhere. Free parking, rooms are all very nice, as is the restaurant. I will always recommend this hotel as opposed to any other hotel in San Pedro/Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, not a 4-star at all”
Reviews.Author: tradingbee
Reviews.Content: Although it looked like the hotel had been renovated not long ago, but the decor already looking dated, and the room had a musky smell when we arrived, and what's worse was that the smell stayed on the whole time, even after we sprayed with the air freshener they provide. The restaurant was substandard, food was not good, steak was overcooked and the sauce and mashed potatoes tasted like instant food. The service can use some improvement, too. We waited for almost an hour for them to come take orders when it was not even full. While having dinner in the restaurant, a senior Asian man was yelling at a worker, and we heard that he was the GM. Very rude and unprofessional! The TV program was bare minimal, and the wireless internet connection was dodging, very annoying! Maybe it's good for pre- or post- cruise stay, but definitely not a business hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for night before cruising out of Port of LA in San Pedro, CA”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue1987
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for an overnight stay for a cruise out of the Port of LA in San Pedro, and it was absolutely perfect. They offer a free shuttle to the pier, and it only takes about 5 minutes time. The staff was very courteous, and even provided us with free toothbrushes, toothpaste, and combs when our luggage was lost for a few hours at LAX. Room was very clean, and beds were quite comfortable. If you need an overnight hotel before or after a cruise out of San Pedro, you simply can not go wrong with the Crowne Plaza. The best thing to do in San Pedro is the Cabrillo Marine Aquarium. The Crowne Plaza offers a free shuttle to and from the aquarium (or anywhere else within a 5 mile radius of the hotel). The aquarium describes itself as an "educational" aquarium -- which means that its not overly fancy (no dolphin shows, etc), but it does offer some outstanding exhibits of local Southern California fish and marine life. They only ask for an optional $5 donation for adults, and $1 for children, and it is completely worth it. After the aquarium, you can walk across the parking lot to Cabrillo Beach as well. We ate dinner and the next morning's breakfast at the Grinder restaurant which is about 1 block from the Crowne Plaza -- it's basically like a Denny's or a Perkins. The food was very reasonably priced, very tasty, and the service was extremely friendly as well. Take advantage of the free shuttle service at the hotel -- they ran the shuttles with a sign-up sheet system, and were always very prompt picking us back up after we called them from our location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park and Sail Program”
Reviews.Author: Hendersongal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for one night prior to our Mexican Riviera Cruise on the Mariner of the Seas. We booked a Park and Sail package directly through the hotel, which turned out to be perfect for us. The package included the room, a welcome drink, the breakfast buffet, shuttle service to and from the ship and valet parking for the duration of the cruise. We drove in from Las Vegas and arrived in San Pedro at about 7 p.m. We checked in and brought our luggage to our room. The room was a good size and clean. We wanted a king bed so we had to upgrade to the executive level because those were the only king bed rooms available. It wasn’t much of an upgrade – there was a room on that floor where they were supposed to have snacks, etc., but it was never open. So I probably would advise against the upgrade to the executive level. We then enjoyed our welcome drink in the lounge and listened to the nice trio that was playing. We then ate at the Green Onion, which was about two blocks from the hotel. Good Mexican food at very reasonable prices and cold beers to help us enjoy the start of our vacation. The next morning we had the breakfast buffet, which was quite good, and took a walk before hoping on the shuttle for our cruise. The port is only a couple of blocks from this hotel so if you didn’t have a lot of luggage you could actually walk to the ship. After returning from the cruise, we waited for a just a few minutes for the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. We got the car and off we went back to Las Vegas. Only real complaint was the exercise room - it wasn’t much – there were only a couple of cardio machines and some weight machines that looked like they were from the 70s.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanR421
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance from the port. They do offer complimentary shuttle service to the pier on the morning of your cruise. This was great. We were there in 10 minutes. They don't have shuttle service from LAX so we took Super Shuttle which cost $17 per person. You can pre-book online if you want. We didn't and it worked out just fine. The staff at the hotel are friendly and very helpful. We ate in a mexican restaurant - The Green Onion- which is about a block away on 6th Street. It was really good and reasonable. If you walk 2 blocks in the other direction on 6th Street, there is a nice Starbucks. In the morning when we got up and looked out the window, which was facing the port, we saw our boat, the Sapphire Princess. We had the buffet breakfast in the hotel. Nothing special, but not bad. All in all, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pickypickyAustin
Reviews.Content: Although the reviews seemed to be fairly decent for this hotel, I was not satisfied. Though the lobby and the hotel service are very inviting, the rooms are in terrible shape. VERY dirty carpet: completely stained and not even properly vacuumed. It really grossed me out. Multiple long hairs all over the bathroom floors too.

Reviews.Title: “Close to San Pedro World Cruise Center”
Reviews.Author: pegcruiser
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this hotel for four nights prior to a cruise to the Mexican Riviera. It is located about 5 minutes from the World Cruise Center in San Pedro. It's about a one hour and $55 dollar taxi ride from LAX. Check-in was fast. We had purchased a hotel package through a Canadian travel wholesaler and this was accepted without problem. The room was very good, comfortable, well-equipped except that it did not have a mini-fridge or a safe, something we're accustomed to seeing in this type of hotel. The concierge was excellent and arranged for a car and driver for a couple of trips, one to Burbank to see Jay Leno, and a post-cruise tour of Hollywood, etc., including a transfer to LAX. The Restaurant is called Juliette's. It's OK but has a south Asian theme. The buffet is just OK; one morning, the bacon was burned beyond recognition. Try some of the other restaurants in the area but make sure you know where you are going or get the hotel shuttle. There are a number of landmarks to see in the San Pedro area, including the LA Maritime Museum, Cabrillo Marine Aquarium and the Ports O' Call Village. The hotel provides shuttle services within San Pedro and to the World Cruise Center. In spite of the stated policy of "within San Pedro" it does make runs to the Long Beach cruise terminal to pick up Carnival cruise passengers; this is something of a contradiction. It does get busy on weekends when cruise passengers are being transferred to and from the cruise terminals so ask the Bell staff for the "Cruise Ship Information" sheet for times and procedures. We would recommend bringing your luggage to the lobby yourself as the Bell staff are overwhelmed during this process. We did not use the fitness facilities, pool or bar. Our check out was a bit strained when the hotel tried to charge us for the stay instead of crediting us with the hotel voucher we had provided; not a huge problem but it did lower our opinion of the hotel. All in all, an enjoyable stay. What we liked best: location, polite staff What we liked least: conflicting information about the shuttle service, buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great location pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: lovesoftball
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in December prior to NCL cruise. The location of this hotel is perfect. The hotel was nice, room was good. Restraunt was under renovation, so we did not eat there. We love to walk and see the sights, we found a wonderful cafe about 4 blocks up the hill from the hotel called "George's". They serve breakfast, lunch & dinner. Excellent food, service and very reasonable prices. The waiter and owner came over and spoke to us and gave us advise on what to see and where to go. We also ate at the Green Onion, (mexican) about 1/2 block from hotel. It was very average mexican food and service. CVS Pharmacy is located about 6 blocks away from hotel. We took the city bus 142 to Long Beach to sight see. The only negative was the hotel staff was not very friendly or helpful, but as you will read in the reviews, this is a common opinion. So, if you are somewhat self sufficient, this is a good hotel, just don't expect much from the hotel staff. Vans are only used on an "availability" basis. With cruise ships coming & going at the same time, vans were busy and not always available to transport guests to our destination. We were a family of four, we took the Shuttle Blue to and from LAX. They were very prompt. We reserved our room at Crowne Plaza on Priceline.com and got it for $65/night which was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: ClaireeTurnip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (20/12/08) pre cruise. Our room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. We didn't eat at the hotel that evening as we asked the concierge to recommend a local pizza place (which I think was called Ricks) and this was excellent - nothing fancy but good wholesome food and a wide choice of beer. The buffet breakfast the following morning was appalling. It looked like the main restaurant was being renovated and so we were ushered into a function room which had wholly inadequate seating laid out for the amount of people who were obviously staying at the hotel. The choice of food was VERY limited and the amount of food available was also VERY limited. The price of breakfast was included in our rate but if I'd have been asked to pay an extra $16 or so + tax pp I'd have been angry and disappointed. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to the cruise ship terminal which runs every 30 mins from 10.30 am on a Sunday morning. Taking everything into account, as a one night pre cruise hotel, the Crowne Plaza is a good choice and when we cruise from LA in the future we will stay here again but on room only just in case the breakfast choice hasn't improved!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise hotel with free cruise shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza in San Pedro for one night pre-cruise. The Crowne Plaza is about a 20-25 minute ride from the Long Beach airport, but the hotel doesn’t offer an airport shuttle. However, we had reserved space on-line in advance for the four of us with Prime Time Shuttle service for $42 total. The shuttle was ready and waiting when we arrived! The Crowne Plaza itself is a very popular pre-cruise hotel. Though we arrived to the hotel at 11 a.m., and check-in was not until 3 p.m., our two rooms were ready for us. The concierge was the highlight of our stay, welcoming us warmly upon arrival and promptly giving me his business card and offering up his area recommendations (which I did use). After unpacking and quickly settling in, the concierge arranged a driver for us who would first take us to In-N-Out Burger, wait while we nibbled, take us to the Queen Mary back in Long Beach, then pick us up at the end of the day and drive us back to the Crowne Plaza in San Pedro. He promptly offered a driver who would do all of this for $65 total. What a bargain! With tip, we ended up paying $80 (or $20 per person) for this service. The Queen Mary tour is something I highly recommend for anyone interested in ghost stories or the paranormal. While the ship itself really has not been well-maintained, i.e. stained carpets, mildew smell in certain areas, paint chipped from walls, scrapes and marks on walls, and a basic look of a once-beautiful ship just kept for tours, it does offer a fun and engaging look at the ghosts and legends that make up her history. We opted for the “Haunted Encounters Passport” which entitled us to the self-guided tour (beware that if you are not good with directions, your feet will become weary from losing your way in the bowels of the ship), the “Ghosts and Legends” tour and the “Haunted Encounters” tour for a cost of $27.95 per person. The fee was well worth the tours of areas not open to the public for general browsing, as we were exposed to a doorway where a crew member had been crushed and has been known to still visit the space, the boiler room where a young girl’s spirit visits on occasion, and various cabins where passengers had died – and have “come back to life” – over the course of Queen Mary’s life on the seas. Dedicate 3-4 hours to ensure you have time to join in the guided tours as they do fill up fast! Once back to the Crowne Plaza, we asked the concierge for a good recommendation for dinner. He made no hesitation in recommending Raffaello’s Ristorante in San Pedro. The valet drove us in a complimentary hotel van to dinner, where we were promptly seated simply by mentioning the name of our concierge (though we had no reservations and the place was packed!). The Italian food was very, very good with the mozzarella sticks being the table favorite! They really weren’t “sticks” per se – they were really more like flattened pieces of cheese that had been lightly breaded and baked, and swimming in a very good marinara sauce. None of us finished our huge meals, probably because the chef sent us a couple of appetizers “on the house”. After the meal, we ventured back to the Crowne Plaza, only a 4 block walk. The morning of disembarkation, we leisurely made our way to the lobby where we caught the Crowne Plaza’s free cruise shuttle just before noon (the shuttle actually begins at 10:30 a.m.) and arrived to the port by 12:05 p.m. As easy as pie.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gargoyle999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Thanksgiving and the day after prior to a Princess cruise. Lobby was clean and staff was friendly. They have free indoor parking which was nice. Room was a King bed and was nice, clean, things worked fine. Bed was comfortable. A minor issue was the in wall air conditioner was a bit loud, though it did not keep me from sleeping! We could see the pool area and jacuzzi. It looked nice though we did not use it. It is close to the cruise port and the free shuttle is nice. It is first come first served. It starts at 10:30am, though we were in the lobby at 9:30am and got on when they brought back some passengers who just got off the Sapphire! We wished we would have had more time to explore the area around the hotel but went to Disneyland on our "free" day before the cruise so did not have time. Head south along the channel and there are a lot of restaurants, we did not know about them until we saw them during sailaway! One thing that bothered us was that we confirmed via phone and email prior to our stay that their restaurant would be open normal hours on Thanksgiving. But when we arrived there was a notice it was closed at 3pm. They did have room service which was ok, not great. But there are a lot of extra charges for room service. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again when sailing from San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewphelps
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, very near to the San Pedro cruise dock. The hotel room was very nice, with comfortable beds. Good walkable area in the morning for folks from the east coast who are up early. Breakfast in the morning was expensive, but nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but maybe over priced”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastguyYVR
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great, right by the cruise terminal. Literally a 3-5 minute shuttle ride if that. You could walk it if you had to. There are some restaurants and bars in the area, but nothing too exciting. It is the LA Harbor after all, which is fairly industrial. We booked an Executive Suite with King Bed. It has a separate living area with pull out sofa. The total was $243 USD after all the taxes. I think just a normal room would have run us about $190 USD, and the extra space as good since other friends of ours were staying in the hotel and could come and visit as we waited in the morning to head over to our ship. The bed was comfortable, as all Crowne Plaza beds seem to be. But to be honest, I think it is a bit overpriced. I probably wouldn't stay here again unless I can get a room for $100-125 USD.

Reviews.Title: “great value and good location for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: swintontraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in between 2 cruises.. The shuttle driver managed to get all the luggage in from one large group and still fit us in. We arrived at the hotel about 10.30AM and were allowed to check in to our room straight away !!!! We realised we had been upgraded to the 10th Floor Crown lounge level when we had to use our room key to operate the lift.
